snippet: The T.S.A.’s expensive program to identify high-risk passengers on the basis of mostly nonverbal signs is proving to be ineffective.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Transportation Security Administration behavior detection program; holds it has not made TSA agents any better at identifying high-risk passengers despite its nearly $1 billion price tag; urges Congress to take advice of Government Accountability Office and limit funding for the program.
lead_paragraph: The T.S.A.’s expensive program to identify high-risk passengers on the basis of mostly nonverbal signs is proving to be ineffective.
